text: future islands in evening air hello my
needle drops hope everyone's doing well
a new t-shirt got it over at my favorite
record store red scroll records future
islands this band their new LP has been
staring me in the face since May and I
apologize it's taken me until now to
review because sometimes I just thanks
in evening air is the title of this
thing and right from the get-go it is
pretty apparent that these guys are huge
fans of New Wave considering all of
these synthesizers and drum machines and
lightly reverb bass something that
sounds a little similar to maybe Joy
Division's Unknown Pleasures this LP is
on Thrill Jockey in the past these guys
have released LPS on upset the rhythm
and they're a part of the ym city
collective which includes artists such
as adventurer and Dan Deacon who this
band has actually had a split come out
with so easy to say here that if you
were to listen to this LP you're in for
something that is fun and kind of
eccentric as well this band has put out
a lot of music since they're starting Oh
6 a lot of it actually being self
released CDRs under a different name art
Lord and these self-portraits
however this LP doesn't really make me
all that curious about their past work
some songs I literally have just nothing
but love for but there are moments that
just leave me wanting more they're so
close so close to something just amazing
evening their future islands really belt
out some fantastic ballads like the
opening walking through that door that
track for me is really the closest they
come to perfection on here great hook
good melody super emotional vocal
delivery and as long as we're on the
vocals we really need to talk about them
for a little bit as much as I don't want
to boil this band down to one thing it's
kind of unavoidable the vocals really
are the most distinct thing that they
have going for them there's a lot of
rasp there this guy's voice is rough
dirty but it's very melodic too it's not
like it's just yelling and loud
noisy a lot of people I've read and have
heard in conversation kind of liken it
to that of Tom Waits though I don't
really see the comparison yeah it's
rough and it's raspy but it's the dudes
voice what are you gonna do however it's
not as if it's not intentional there are
some tracks on here where he actually
kind of pulls back on the rasp eNOS and
his vocals sound very smooth and then
there are moments like the track tinman
where he just lets it all go just you
know so at least he has control over it
there's some great song ideas on this LP
but in one way or another I feel like
the band kind of falls short like on the
song Tin Man where I feel like the
production kind of hampers the tracks
enjoyability especially when it gets
loud and distorted and the song inch of
dust is really one of my favorite
moments on this thing but like a lot of
tracks on this it leaves me kind of cold
because the song just ends abruptly as
if an ending couldn't have been drummed
up you've got a filler instrumental a
really repetitive closer and just all of
these men and skippable moments just add
up into an album that feels a little
lackluster despite the fact that there
are some great tracks on it along with a
pretty unique sound I'm feeling a decent
too strong 7 on this because for me it's
kind of just stopping short of being
amazing but I am talking about this
thing not because I want you guys to
necessarily know how I feel about it but
because I think this could actually be
the band of 2010 for a lot of people if
someone is in fact looking for just some
electro pop with a very dark moody edge
and unique vocals this is certainly a
mutant of an album right here and I just
had to just put my two cents down on it
because whether or not I am in love with
every song on the album
it is a noteworthy thing isn't know
where the LP but that's how I'm feeling
